3: Let's... play...
L-le-let's...
Shark-speare crumbles, letting off distorted noises, then collapses in front of you.
Is it over...?
Commandant, please sit and rest, now...
I'll call Babylonia!
With Liv's support, you slowly lie on the ground.
The sky of the theme park fills your vision. The faint traces of the moon and the stars in daylight bespeckle the clear blue of the summer skies.
Is everything over?
Perhaps.
...What did they call this again? A holiday? President Hassen needs to get that overtime pay ready. Double.
...And, a detailed report about Luna and Shome would have to be written too. Best get the Engineering Force in to just blow the place up and rebuild it as well.
...As for what's in Shome's spine... Well, let's forget about that. As long as it's in the report, Asimov will sort it out.
...With things finally at an end, a wave of fatigue washes over. Eyelids... drooping...
Commandant... What's wrong?
Commandant seems to have slept...
You guys take care of Commandant for a while. I'll call for reinforcements.
Meanwhile, in a high place that overlooks the plaza...
Inelegant, but our goal has been achieved.
Our goodbyes will have to wait until another day.
Luna leaps high into the air, then twists and dissipates, melting into the sky.
